Togo - Troisieme projet de developpement

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Forestry
            Project for the Ivory Coast was unsatisfactory. The project
            did not achieve many of its objectives, institutional
            development was negligible, sustainability is unlikely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            unsatisfactory. Lessons to be drawn from this project are
            similar to those derived from many of the other Bank's
            integrated rural development projects. The establishment of
            region-specific, specialized project institutions does not
            compensate, in the long run, for a weak national program of
            agricultural support services; the aim should be to provide
            training and technical assistance that will enable the
            Government to strengthen these services. The project also
            demonstrated that it is difficult for crop-based rural
            development agencies to satisfactorily assume the
            responsibility for promoting food crops. In tackling the
            deficit of the tree crop development agencies, it will be
            necessary for food crop promotion to be financed under
            Government's general program of research and extension,
            rather than charged to coffee-cocoa producers.
